summary:
Approved as a literary translator by the Dutch Foundation for Literature.

Books:
'The House of Orange in Revolution and War: A European History 1772-1890 (2022), J. Koch, D, van der Meulen and J. van Zanten, Reaktion Books, London
'Radical Redemption: What Terrorists Believe', Beatrice de Graaf (delivered September 2021)
'You Were Smiling' (2020), Kirsten Withagen
'Pluses and Minuses' (2020), Stefan Buijsman, Orion Books, London
'Blood Rush' (2020), Jan Verplaetse, Reaktion Books, London
'The Netherlands and European Integration' (2020), Mathieu Segers, AUP, Amsterdam
'The Eighty Years' War' (2019), LUP, Leiden (with Annette Mills and Helen Bannatyne)
'Revolt in the Netherlands' (2018), Anton van der Lem, Reaktion Books, London
'Under the Knife' (2018), Arnold van de Laar, John Murray, London
'Fear!: Extreme Athletes on How to Reach Your Highest Goals and Overcome Stress and Self Doubt' (2018) Roanne van Voorst, Motivational Press, US
'The Planet Hunters' (2017), Lucas Ellerbroek, Reaktion Books, London
'The Way of the Iceman' (2016), Wim Hof and Koen de Jong, Dragon Door Publications, US
‘The Low Sky’ (8th edition 2016), Han van der Horst, Scriptum, Schiedam
‘Liberia: From the ideal of freedom to paradise lost’  (2015), Fred van der Kraaij, African Studies Centre, Leiden
'The Making of a Man'​ (2015), Maxim Februari, Reaktion Books, London
'Deep Space'​ (2014), Govert Schilling, Black Dog & Leventhal, New York
'Mobilizing Labour for the Global Coffee Market' (2015), Jan Breman, AUP, Amsterdam
'The Encyclopedia of Liars and Deceivers'​ (2014), Roelf Bolt, Reaktion Books, London
'Why Hell Stinks of Sulfur' (2013), Salomon Kroonenberg, Reaktion Books, London
‘How James Watt Invented the Copier’ (2011), René Schils, Springer, New York
‘In Byron’s Footsteps’ (2011), Tessa de Loo, Haus/The Armchair Traveller, London
‘Atlas of Astronomical Discoveries’ (2011), Govert Schilling, Springer, New York
‘The Hunt for Planet X’ (2009), Govert Schilling, Springer, New York.
